Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Oxidized Zirconium and Stainless Steel Femoral Heads in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: One hundred patients eligible for cemented THA were randomised

Participants.evidence: One hundred patients eligible for cemented THA

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either oxidized zirconium or stainless steel femoral heads

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial evaluated the wear rates of oxidized zirconium versus stainless steel femoral heads in total hip arthroplasty

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was femoral head penetration, measured over a minimum follow-up of 4 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: One hundred patients eligible for cemented THA were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: Complete follow-up data were available for 86 patients
